title: Cauliflower in Tomato Sauce
introduction: Cauliflower in Tomato Sauce is an exquisite dish that brings out the rich flavor of tomatoes combined with the tender, mild taste of cauliflower. The addition of basil or parsley adds a fresh herbaceous note to the sauce, making it a delightful accompaniment to nearly any meal. For a special touch, you can add capers or use the sauce as a pasta topping, garnished with toasted bread crumbs.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil or flat-leaf parsley
instructions: 1. Cut the cauliflower into 2-inch florets. Trim off the ends of the stems. Cut thick stems crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.

2. In a large saucepan, cook the onion, garlic, and crushed red pepper in the oil over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the onion is tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes. Bring to a simmer. Cook 10 minutes.
3. Stir in the cauliflower and basil or parsley, and salt to taste. Cover and cook 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Uncover and cook 5 minutes more.
variations: Add a handful of drained capers to the sauce.
Use the sauce as a pasta topping, garnished with toasted bread crumbs.
